worklogs.comment:
pearu commented on pull request #3617: ARROW-3653: [C++][Python] Support data copying between different GPU devices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3617
 
 
   This PR introduces new C++ methods
     `CudaContext::CopyDeviceToAnotherDevice`
     `CudaBuffer::CopyFromAnotherDevice`
   that are used to implement the Python support for copying CUDA buffer data between different devices.

pitrou commented on pull request #3617: ARROW-3653: [C++][Python] Support data copying between different GPU devices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3617#discussion_r255884474
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/gpu/cuda_memory.h
 ##########
 @@ -80,6 +80,15 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT CudaBuffer : public Buffer {
   /// memories have been allocated within the same context.
   Status CopyFromDevice(const int64_t position, const void* data, int64_t nbytes);
 
+  /// \brief Copy memory from another device to device at position
+  /// \param[in] src_ctx context of the another device memory
 
 Review comment:
   "context of the source device memory"?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3617: ARROW-3653: [C++][Python] Support data copying between different GPU devices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3617#discussion_r255885305
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_cuda.py
 ##########
 @@ -398,11 +401,13 @@ def test_copy_to_host(size):
             dbuf.copy_to_host(buf=buf, position=position, nbytes=nbytes)
 
 
+@pytest.mark.parametrize("dest_ctx", ['same', 'another'])
 @pytest.mark.parametrize("size", [0, 1, 1000])
-def test_copy_from_device(size):
+def test_copy_from_device(dest_ctx, size):
     arr, buf = make_random_buffer(size=size, target='device')
     lst = arr.tolist()
-    dbuf = buf.context.new_buffer(size)
+    dest_ctx = buf.context if dest_ctx == 'same' else global_context1
 
 Review comment:
   Perhaps skip the test if the two contexts are the same regardless? It would help know whether the "two different devices" case actually gets tested (for example I have a single CUDA GPU).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pearu commented on pull request #3617: ARROW-3653: [C++][Python] Support data copying between different GPU devices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3617#discussion_r255924964
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/gpu/cuda_memory.h
 ##########
 @@ -80,6 +80,15 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT CudaBuffer : public Buffer {
   /// memories have been allocated within the same context.
   Status CopyFromDevice(const int64_t position, const void* data, int64_t nbytes);
 
+  /// \brief Copy memory from another device to device at position
+  /// \param[in] src_ctx context of the another device memory
 
 Review comment:
   fixed
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

pearu commented on pull request #3617: ARROW-3653: [C++][Python] Support data copying between different GPU devices
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3617#discussion_r255927495
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_cuda.py
 ##########
 @@ -398,11 +401,13 @@ def test_copy_to_host(size):
             dbuf.copy_to_host(buf=buf, position=position, nbytes=nbytes)
 
 
+@pytest.mark.parametrize("dest_ctx", ['same', 'another'])
 @pytest.mark.parametrize("size", [0, 1, 1000])
-def test_copy_from_device(size):
+def test_copy_from_device(dest_ctx, size):
     arr, buf = make_random_buffer(size=size, target='device')
     lst = arr.tolist()
-    dbuf = buf.context.new_buffer(size)
+    dest_ctx = buf.context if dest_ctx == 'same' else global_context1
 
 Review comment:
   Now on a single GPU system the test  labelled as `another` is skipped because it would be exactly the same as the test labelled as `same`.
   
   The only way to know that copying between two different devices works is to create two
   buffers on both devices, make a copy, and then check if the destination buffer contains the
   expected data. This is all implemented in the test_copy_from_device function.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently, the data copying is supported from host to device, from device to host, from device to the same device. For multiple GPU systems, copying data from one device to another is needed.

See also
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2844#discussion_r228910757
fields.summary: [Python/C++] Support data copying between different GPU devices

comments.body: Would you like to submit a patch for this?
Yes, I can submit a patch. However, I don't have access to a multi-GPU system. So, I would not be able to fully test it.
I can create a user account for you on one of our multi-GPU machines. I think you should be able to test this without sudo?

Sounds good. As long as the nvidia driver is working and there is enough disk space to create a development environment, sudo access would not be needed. Let me know if you need anything from me for creating the account.
